identification.role: Military officer, leader of a unit under Corvus; one of the Four Horsemen; aggressive enforcer of Rome's might
identification.primary_narrative_function: Instrument of endless violence through supernatural curse

physical_description.age: 27-30 years old (living state); frozen at 30 (cursed state)
physical_description.build: Above average (approximately 6'0"); heavily muscular; thick shoulders; powerful frame

distinctive_features.scars: Thick scar down left forearm; parallel scars across chest; rope burn marks on wrists
distinctive_features.marks_tattoos: Standard Roman military tattoos; Mars symbol prominently on right shoulder; small marks on forearms indicating combat kills
distinctive_features.unusual_features: Nose broken at least three times; misaligned; pale blue eyes (unusual for Italian); scar tissue around eyes from boxing or street fighting
distinctive_features.bearing: Upright but less rigid than Brutus; confident in physical dominance; sometimes slightly forward-leaning (aggressive posture)

physical_description.visual_signature: Impressive physical presence; obviously trained in combat; becomes increasingly disheveled as curse manifests

primary_traits.description: Exceptional warrior; strength and fighting skill are extraordinary; few can match him in direct combat
Excels at direct application of force; executes aggressive strategies with commitment and efficiency
Commands respect through physical dominance and demonstrated strength; subordinates follow him eagerly
Prefers immediate action over strategic planning; strength-obsessed; restless when inactive

strengths.shows_in: Dominates in sparring; leaves opponents severely injured or dead; feared in hand-to-hand combat
Achieves objectives through forceful action; subordinates follow his aggressive lead; succeeds at combat-focused tasks
Unit performs well under his command; morale is high; soldiers want to follow him

flaws_and_vulnerabilities.manifestation: Prefers direct action; complex strategy is difficult; often wants to attack when subtlety would be more effective
Has not developed emotional sophistication; restless, easily frustrated, acts impulsively
Categorizes people as strong or weak; those he deems weak are treated with contempt and sometimes brutality
Frozen at age 30; transformed into instrument of endless violence; restlessness becomes compulsive; aggression becomes autonomous

relationships.dynamic: Maximus serves under Corvus; respects command structure; executes aggressive strategies
Brutus directs; Maximus executes; clear hierarchy with strategic coordination

story_arc.opening_state: Confident young officer; physically at peak; respected for strength; ambitious for advancement
story_arc.transformation: Cursed during crucifixion; frozen at age 30; transformed into instrument of endless violence
story_arc.closing_state: Trapped in curse; compulsive violence; autonomous aggression; serves purposes beyond understanding

thematic_significance: Curse as consequence of participation in crucifixion
The Red Horse: war and bloodshed through violence
character.why_readers_care: Maximus represents the cost of violenceâ€”not just to victims but to perpetrators. His curse demonstrates that participation in evil has consequences that transform the perpetrator. His physical dominance becomes a trap, and his action-focused nature leads him into a cycle of violence he cannot escape. Through Maximus, readers see how strength can become weakness, and how violence can consume those who wield it.
character_questions_for_readers: What is the cost of violence to the perpetrator?
How does participation in evil transform us?
Can violence become autonomous and compulsive?
What happens when action replaces thought?
